title: Can you damage a device using the wrong USB cable (USB, USB on the Go, Android)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Only if you have to hammer it in! The biggest danger is the homebrew USB lead that some bright boy has connected to a 24v power source (used for my portable soldering iron :D). An OTG cable links ground (tag 5) to link contact 4 — the sense lead. Because OTG needs to be enabled in menu and connected to another device I can’t see it doing anything bad if you mistakenly connect the wrong phone to the wrong lead at the wrong time (unlike my 24v killer)

No, there is no way, unless the USB cable happened to be plugged into mains or other high-voltage source without a transformer. That might damage the device if it does not have ample protection against such. USB OTG is recognised by devices because 2 of the pins are shorted. Otherwise, USB and USB OTG are the same
